problems.title: Subsets (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given an integer array nums of unique elements, return all possible subsets (the power set).
The solution set must not contain duplicate subsets. Return the solution in any order.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
1 2 3

Sample Output
[] [1] [2] [1,2] [3] [1,3] [2,3] [1,2,3]

Explanation: All possible subsets of [1,2,3].

Sample Input
0

Sample Output
[] [0]

Explanation: All possible subsets of [0].
problems.constraints:
1 <= nums.length <= 10
-10 <= nums[i] <= 10
All the numbers of nums are unique.

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def subsets(self, nums):
        # TODO: Return all possible subsets
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    nums = list(map(int, sys.stdin.read().strip().split()))
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.subsets(nums)
    # Format output: [] [1] [2] [1,2] ...
    output = []
    for subset in result:
        output.append('[' + ','.join(map(str, subset)) + ']')
    print(' '.join(output))

hintsList: Use bit manipulation: each number from 0 to 2^n - 1 represents a subset.
For each number, check which bits are set to include corresponding elements.
